slides.title: Welcome to ACCA FR
slides.content:
# Financial Reporting (FR)

FR covers the application of **IFRS standards** in financial statements.

## What You Will Learn

- **Conceptual Framework** - Principles
- **Key IAS/IFRS** - Standards application
- **Group Accounts** - Consolidation
- **Interpretation** - Ratio analysis

## Syllabus Areas

| Area | Weight |
|------|--------|
| Framework | 10% |
| IAS/IFRS | 45% |
| Group accounts | 30% |
| Interpretation | 15% |

slides.title: Conceptual Framework
slides.content:
# IASB Conceptual Framework

## Purpose

- Guide standard setting
- Assist preparers
- Help users understand

## Qualitative Characteristics

| Fundamental | Enhancing |
|-------------|----------|
| Relevance | Comparability |
| Faithful representation | Verifiability |
| | Timeliness |
| | Understandability |

## Elements of FS

| Element | Definition |
|---------|------------|
| Asset | Future economic benefit |
| Liability | Present obligation |
| Equity | Residual interest |
| Income | Increase in assets |
| Expense | Decrease in assets |

slides.title: IAS 16 - PPE
slides.content:
# Property, Plant and Equipment

## Recognition

When:
- Probable future benefits
- Cost can be measured reliably

## Initial Measurement

```
Purchase Price
+ Directly attributable costs
+ Dismantling costs (if obliged)
= Initial Cost
```

## Subsequent Measurement

| Model | Basis |
|-------|-------|
| Cost | Cost less depreciation |
| Revaluation | Fair value |

## Depreciation

```
(Cost - Residual Value) / Useful Life
```

## Revaluation

- Gain: OCI (unless reversal)
- Loss: P&L (unless previous gain)

slides.title: IAS 16 Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: Under the revaluation model, where is a revaluation gain recognized (first-time)?

slides.title: IAS 38 - Intangibles
slides.content:
# Intangible Assets

## Definition

Identifiable non-monetary asset without physical substance.

## Recognition

| Source | Treatment |
|--------|----------|
| Purchased | Capitalize |
| Internally developed | R&D rules |

## R&D Costs

| Phase | Treatment |
|-------|----------|
| Research | Expense |
| Development | Capitalize (if criteria) |

## Development Criteria

- Technical feasibility
- Intention to complete
- Ability to use/sell
- Generate benefits
- Resources available
- Reliable measurement

slides.title: IAS 36 - Impairment
slides.content:
# Impairment of Assets

## When to Test

- Indication of impairment
- Annually for goodwill/intangibles

## Recoverable Amount

```
Higher of:
- Fair value less costs to sell
- Value in use
```

## Value in Use

```
Present value of future cash flows
using appropriate discount rate
```

## Impairment Loss

```
Carrying amount - Recoverable amount
= Impairment loss

Recognize in P&L
(unless revalued asset)
```

## Reversal

- Allowed for most assets
- Not allowed for goodwill

slides.title: IAS 37 - Provisions
slides.content:
# Provisions and Contingencies

## Provision Recognition

| Criteria | Required |
|----------|----------|
| Present obligation | Yes |
| Probable outflow | Yes |
| Reliable estimate | Yes |

## Contingent Liabilities

| Probability | Treatment |
|-------------|----------|
| Probable | Provide |
| Possible | Disclose |
| Remote | Nothing |

## Contingent Assets

| Probability | Treatment |
|-------------|----------|
| Virtually certain | Recognize |
| Probable | Disclose |
| Possible | Nothing |

slides.title: IFRS 15 - Revenue
slides.content:
# Revenue from Contracts

## Five-Step Model

```
1. Identify contract
2. Identify performance obligations
3. Determine transaction price
4. Allocate to obligations
5. Recognize when satisfied
```

## Performance Obligation

| Type | Recognition |
|------|-------------|
| Point in time | On transfer |
| Over time | As progress |

## Over Time Criteria

- Customer receives benefit
- Asset with no alternative use
- Enforceable right to payment

slides.title: IFRS 15 Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: How many steps are in the IFRS 15 revenue recognition model?

slides.title: IFRS 16 - Leases
slides.content:
# Leases

## Lessee Accounting

All leases (except exemptions):

```
Recognize:
- Right-of-use asset
- Lease liability
```

## Initial Measurement

| Item | Basis |
|------|-------|
| ROU Asset | Lease liability + direct costs |
| Liability | PV of lease payments |

## Subsequent

| Item | Treatment |
|------|----------|
| ROU Asset | Depreciate |
| Liability | Reduce by payments |
| Interest | Recognize in P&L |

## Exemptions

- Short-term (< 12 months)
- Low value assets

slides.title: Group Accounts - Basics
slides.content:
# Consolidated Financial Statements

## When to Consolidate

Parent controls subsidiary.

## Control Exists When

- Power over investee
- Exposure to variable returns
- Ability to use power

## Basic Consolidation

```
100% Parent assets
+ 100% Subsidiary assets
- Intra-group balances
= Consolidated assets
```

## Elimination

| Eliminate | Reason |
|-----------|--------|
| Investment in sub | Replaced by assets |
| Intra-group receivables | Internal balances |
| Intra-group sales | Internal transactions |

slides.title: Goodwill and NCI
slides.content:
# Goodwill Calculation

## Formula

```
Consideration
+ NCI at acquisition
- Fair value of net assets
= Goodwill
```

## NCI Measurement

| Method | Basis |
|--------|-------|
| Fair value | Includes goodwill |
| Proportionate | NCI% x net assets |

## Impairment

- Test annually n- Impair goodwill first
- Cannot reverse

## NCI in SOFP

```
NCI at acquisition
+ NCI share of post-acq profits
= NCI at year end
```

slides.title: Associates
slides.content:
# Associates and Joint Ventures

## Associate

Significant influence (usually 20-50%).

## Equity Method

```
Investment in associate:

Cost of investment
+ Share of post-acq profits
- Dividends received
= Carrying amount
```

## Consolidation

| In SOFP | In P&L |
|---------|--------|
| Single line asset | Share of profit |

## Joint Ventures

- Joint control
- Same equity method

slides.title: Groups Quiz
slides.quizQuestion: At what level of investment is significant influence typically presumed?

slides.title: Statement of Cash Flows
slides.content:
# IAS 7 - Cash Flows

## Three Categories

| Activity | Examples |
|----------|----------|
| Operating | Trading cash |
| Investing | Asset purchases |
| Financing | Loans, dividends |

## Operating - Indirect

```
Profit before tax
+ Depreciation
+ Finance costs
+/- Working capital changes
= Cash from operations
```

## Non-Cash Items

- Depreciation
- Impairment
- Revaluation gains/losses
- Share-based payments

slides.title: Interpretation
slides.content:
# Financial Analysis

## Ratio Categories

| Category | Measures |
|----------|----------|
| Profitability | Margins, ROCE |
| Liquidity | Current, quick ratio |
| Gearing | Debt/equity |
| Efficiency | Turnover ratios |

## Key Ratios

```
ROCE = PBIT / CE x 100

Gross margin = GP / Revenue x 100

Current ratio = CA / CL

Gearing = Debt / Equity x 100
```

## Limitations

- Historic data
- Different policies
- Non-financial ignored

slides.title: Other Standards
slides.content:
# Other Key Standards

## IAS 2 - Inventory

```
Lower of:
- Cost
- NRV
```

## IAS 10 - Events After

| Type | Treatment |
|------|----------|
| Adjusting | Adjust FS |
| Non-adjusting | Disclose |

## IAS 21 - Foreign Currency

- Translate at closing rate
- Exchange differences in OCI

## IAS 40 - Investment Property

- Fair value or cost model
- FV changes in P&L
